title: SOLID Software Development Projects
description: Developers and clients want to work successfully together, but making agreements or payments internationally is complicated.

f6_assessments.q0:
This sounds like a great concept, however there seems to be a number issues that could derail it.
1) Once you start crossing borders, what does it mean to define a legal agreement. There are no world laws, you need to pick a jurisdiction who's courts will enforce the contract. Hence why many international agreements have been done referencing UK courts with well established case law especially for trade, services and finance
2) How does the smart contract release funds. If it is just at the clients discretion, how is that any better than just having a promise to pay. If both parties need to come to an agreement, the funds could get locked in the contract for ever. How do you arbitrate?

The proposers noted leangle constancy across borders as a potential risk, but really its an existential risk. No technical work should be conducted before this is solved.
f6_assessments.q1:
Whilst the plan as detailed could be delivered, the I think this issues I have raise in the section above relating to legal jurisdictions and release of funds are key impediments to a successful implementation. 
In addition to technical experience, I believe the proposers really need some legal experience before progressing further.
f6_assessments.q2: Delivery of a technical solution can be audited and the proposer have clearly defined metrics for success. The biggest metric that will drive success though is whether it reduces costs whilst ensuring fair treatment to both parties.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is a great and complex implementation that could improve the number of blockchain developers on cardano ecosystem, because this kind of application development attract enormous amounts of people and monetary value. 
The proposal clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem and for the stakeholders (in deep detail for developer, customers and so on.. ). 
In my opinion this proposal reach completely the challenge given, on the contrary, it tries to define, in an innovative way, an entire supply-demand process of the developments on the Cardano blockchain.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal team is completed skilled, but there isn't a business member (eg. business consultant), so in my opinion will able to make a good technical pilot or MVP, but with external professional contributions. 
In relation to the possible success of the initiative, I think that the proposed solution is very ambitious and very complex, it could be successful but there are many many tasks and risks, so my advice is to simplify the steps and reduce the perimeter so as to more easily hit the target (eg a single market, ... ), and consenquenly also reduce the budget
Further I think it's important to improve details about the process related to the issue related to the market or capital risk.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer provides a step-by-step plan for the implementation with clear milestones and a defined time horizon... The proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the work, but there aren't KPI and metrics that define success rate and goals. The proposer has considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement describes a need but doesn't define the underlaying problem. However in the proposal description the proposer is able to reflect this aspect more and is able to set his solution in the right context. The presented platform wants to help a fair and secure workflow for developer and their clients which will be based on smart contracts on Cardano. This proposal could be potentially in the Dapp-challenge as well, but if it supports developers in general it fits in this challenge as well. The impact for Cardano will be, that developers and their clients will have more trust on each other which could attract more devs in general.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer presented a clear roadmap and describes the features of the proposed solution in many details. To further improve this proposal I suggest to add more technical details to the description to understand the process even better. The budget break down is reasonable and the request amount is fairly priced. What is missing here, are some references about the experience of the proposer team. Also who is the team? Is it already existing? Because of the missing technical details and not much information about the team I can rate feasibility of this project only with 3 stars.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer reflected potential risk, but didn't come up with solution how to avoid this challenges or how to overcome them. The timeline and roadmap is realistic from my perspective/knowledge. The team also presented some metrics to measure its success (number of users they want to attract after 12 month). Unfortunately there is not Github linked (or something similar) that documents the progress of this proposal. With the given information I can only give 3 stars about how the community is able to audit the progress of this proposal.

solution: Provide a platform for automated,  tamper-proofed and verified contract execution (payments, milestones, legal). Build trust between parties
experience: 10+ years software development, 5+ years entrepreneur, plutus pioneer, professional blockchain developer, DevOps
